required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Double Tourniquet Technique on Ultrasonographic View of Forearm Veins
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Double Tourniquet Technique on Width and Compressibility of Superficial Veins of Forearm

brief_summary.textblock: Vein compressibility will be assessed after light pressure applied with the ultrasound probe. Vein compressibility will be graded as 3 (100% compressed), 2 (50-100 compressed), and 1 (less than 50% compressed). After baseline measurements were taken, a proximal tourniquet will be applied to mid-arm. Repeated measurements of depth, width, and compressibility will be taken one minute after the tourniquet was applied. Same measurements will be repeated again with second tourniquet applied 1 cm distal to the first tournique.

primary_outcome.measure: Superficial forearm vein width and compressibility under ultrasonography
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 minute after application of one proximal tourniquet
primary_outcome.description: Ultrasonography is used to measure forearm superficial veins width and compressibility

primary_outcome.measure: Superficial forearm vein width and compressibility under ultrasonography
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 minute after application of two proximal tourniquet 1 cm apart
primary_outcome.description: Ultrasonography is used to measure forearm superficial veins width and compressibility

clinical_study.condition: Superficial Forearm Veins Compressibility and Width

intervention.description: Checking vein width snd copression using US

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy volunteers aged 18-60 years will participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients with dialysis shunts, previous mastectomy on the examined side, fracture , skin lesion , burn or edema on the examined side
